1: Lord, my heart is not [a]haughty, Nor my eyes [b]lofty. Neither do I [c]concern myself with great matters, Nor with things too [d]profound for me.
2: Surely I have calmed and quieted my soul, Like a weaned child with his mother; Like a weaned child is my soul within me.
3: O Israel, hope in the Lord From this time forth and forever.
